reviews.sentence: Overpriced filthy room. Thanks for ripping me off. Pokey noisy unclean room. I do nt expect to find big balls of hair from a previous occupant in the corner of the bathroom. Carpets could do with a vacuum.
Great experience. Staff is very helpful and patient. Love the location so convenient to everything. The bathroom wall design is weird.

the location excellent. the style of the room the darkness of the bathroom the LOBBY was beautiful but the room left something to the imagination old carpet dated technology and the room phones and the windows were nice but you could not open windows to get air.

Not bad. stayed for 1 night check in fast the room was clean kind of old but very cozy. Just few blocks away from the center. Price for room service were ok. Check out was fast. Bad they charge you 35 usd for parking station.

Great location average property. We drove down to San Francisco in my pick up truck. We paid about 65 a night for oversized vehicle parking. Think about that. For the cost of most Super 8s outside the city per night we were allowed to park out truck. That was not cool. Then they checked my family into room 301. 301 has the distinction of being right next to the elevators AND directly overlooking the swimming pool and the street beyond. You better believe it was noisy and neither my wife or my 6 month old appreciated it very much. And as other reviewers have noted the pillows suck. And our card keys stopped working almost immediately which sucked because not only do you need them to get into your room but you ALSO need them to work the elevator to get TO your room. As a security measure this is a joke because in a busy hotel like this you only need one guest with a working key to operate the elevator while a group of escaped lunatics can simply get in the elevator with them and go wherever they want. What it really does is simply inconvenience the paying guests who have their arms full of shopping bags have children with them or whose key cards simply stop working. And as other reviewers have noted the bathroom is about the size of a box of tic tacs. If you are in town and these things do not matter to you heres the positive about the property. The location is perfect for hitting the fantastic restaurants and tourist shops in the area. there is a Ross and a Safeway really close in case you need to pick up some last minute food for the room or a missing clothing item. The staff is helpful and friendly 95 of the time and a little extra training would probably close the gap in that last 5This property will do if you really lower your expectations. First rule of real estate location location location. If average simply will not do for you or your family splurge a little and go somewhere else.

Convenient but LOUD. Location is convenient but LOUD. Our room was above the delivery bays and along a street car route clack of the tracks and ding ding ding of the trolley. They are aware as there were ear plugs in the room upon arrival. Hotel needs sprucing up but location and staff were great.

Great location but weak value for money. We really enjoyed the location near Pier 39 Fisherman Wharf. The staff was extremely kind and friendly with one major exception the person attending room service calls. The check in was crowded we had to wait in a line about 15 minutes to get our room key. Then the room we got was really far way we had to walk about 5 minutes to get in and out of the hotel. In terms of décor and style the room was under the expectations for a Sheraton. Breakfast and parking are overpriced. Finally we had a big issue with the person attending room service calls just to get a laundry bag and form to have a pair of pants cleaned. After waiting nearly 30 minutes for it we had to leave as we had an appointment that we could not miss. No one offered to get the pants cleaned without the bag and we had to travel with them for a whole week as they were.

You can do better than this Sheraton. The Sheraton Fisherman ’s Wharf is a large therefore impersonal hotel that is under refurbishment. We stayed in a refurbished King room. The check in process was seamless and friendly. We carried our own bags to the room as the bell hop was not interested in helping. The carpet in the Hall was new and soft to walk on but required a Herculean effort to push the cases. The room was fine save for the following No kettle in the room but provided on request. The cups for a hot drink were paper cups from Starbucks one each per dayThe windows did not open to allow fresh air in. The window blinds were not part of the refurbishment as they were filthy. There was nothing under them and as we were opposite another hotel we could look into each other ’s rooms clearly both day and night. No hot water in the shower or bath. The best was lukewarm but there was hot water in the hand basin so this a choice of the hotel. The walls were wallpapered and had enough air pockets in them to frighten a jumbo jet pilot. The air conditioner was as loud as a jumbo jet engine thus unusable. We stayed four nights and the shampoo was not replaced. The pillows were so frail that by morning they offered no support at all. Twice we sought assistance from the concierge and on both occasions not only did not get help but found the person grumpy aggressive and angry. There is a lot to do here to get this hotel operating at its proper level.

Average. Hotel was sprawling could n’t get 2 rooms in same vicinity despite booking 8 months ahead. Rooms are not insulated so experienced significant noise disturbance from room above. Hotel advertised free WiFi essential for teenagers however the free WiFi was only in lobby area 15 dollar per room per day additional charge. Location was good though and room was clean. Clean room comfy beds good location Close to fisherman ’s wharf 5 minute walk to cable car. Muse mechanique a must see Noisy room from other guests so improvement to soundproofing. free WiFi should mean free WiFi. Not fantastic value for money compared to other hotels.
I would stay here again but would request a room away from the traffic side of the hotel. Due to the Bus Depot and noisy guest above us. I did not sleep 2 out of the 4 nights.

Great hotel in a great location. My partner and I stayed here during a quick trip to San Francisco. The front desk staff were excellent and very accommodating. Our room was up on the 4th in a corner and was a great size with modern decor and furniture. The bed was huge and super comfy. The location is excellent with Fisherman ’s Wharf and the Alcatraz tours nearby as well as great public transport options. There ’s a CVS up the street which is helpful when you ’re travelling light. We actually wished we had booked an extra night in SF because we would have loved to have stayed there again.

Nice hotel. This hotel did n’t disappoint us. It is situated perfectly for everything you need to do in San Fran. There are loads of restaurants nearby and a Safeway just over the road which comes in handy for late night snacking and drinks. Hotel was clean and room had everything we needed. Staff were very friendly.

Spacious. Fantastic staff and service. The room was spacious and had the amenities we needed. It was also a short walk to the piers and all the restaurants and shopping areas. Also close to the Big bus stops which is a great way to get around.

Great hotel. I chose this hotel for it is location and then I read some reviews that were not positive but on arrival I was very happy fabulous location very present staff the hotel was spotless easy check in our king room was massive very clean and up to date showers are great not a thing wrong don t listen to the negative reviews it is a great hotel in an ideal location.

Great hotel for location and price. My wife booked us through “ express deals ” on Expedia which gave us a room for 80. Which was amazing. During that week the minimum was 130 a night. It ’s about a 3 minute walk to the warf but yet away from all the traffic. Clean helpful and an overall very nice hotel.
Property was really close to pier 39 and gherideli square which was really cool. The room had a nice city view. Staff was friendly and overall was a nice hotel to stay at.

Pretty good. Very nice hotel presentation wise. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms are nice. Big downfall is that we could hear noises from the room above. We could hear them walking running around and making thudding noises constantly while we were trying to sleep. Really annoying considering it went on for hours. Made our stay a lot less enjoyable.

Great location very clean friendly. From the super friendly check in to the very clean room with a very nice view up towards Russian Hill we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. One block back from Pier 41 you are spoilt for choice of all the restaurants of Pier 39 or the iconic Ciopino ’s 2 blocks towards the Golden Gate Bridge. There is daily wine tasting in the lobby a generous glass of wine. just pop outside by the outdoor fire pits and comfy couches to enjoy. Recommend this hotel if you ’re looking for a great location super nice beds very clean rooms with friendly and helpful staff. What else do you want.

Well I was impesed on my first stay and disapointed on the next. I love the location. This was second time staying in this hotel. The first time was excellent. I had a good view from my window and very bright in the room. The last time was disapointing they put me in a room facing the other room. I end up closing the blinds all the time coz I feel like no privacy at all. The room service was also disapointing. It took time for thrm to answer the phone and the food was not really that good and superpricey. The gym was so stuffy when I used it. We have to leave the door open coz it was smelly inside.

The location is great but room street noise in the morning not so great. So do n’t plan on sleeping in. Parking also is quite a surprise and should be more reasonable for guests who are already paying a fortune for their room.
